Class SimpleDispatcher

extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • register

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<CommandMapping> register(CommandCallable callable,
                                                                java.lang.String... alias)
        Register a given command using the given list of aliases.

        If there is a conflict with one of the aliases (i.e. that alias is already assigned to another command), then the alias will be skipped. It is possible for there to be no alias to be available out of the provided list of aliases, which would mean that the command would not be assigned to any aliases.

        The first non-conflicted alias becomes the "primary alias."

        Parameters:
        callable - The command
        alias - An array of aliases
        Returns:
        The registered command mapping, unless no aliases could be registered

      • register

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<CommandMapping> register(CommandCallable callable,
                                                                java.util.List<java.lang.String> aliases)
        Register a given command using the given list of aliases.

        If there is a conflict with one of the aliases (i.e. that alias is already assigned to another command), then the alias will be skipped. It is possible for there to be no alias to be available out of the provided list of aliases, which would mean that the command would not be assigned to any aliases.

        The first non-conflicted alias becomes the "primary alias."

        Parameters:
        callable - The command
        aliases - A list of aliases
        Returns:
        The registered command mapping, unless no aliases could be registered

      • register

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<CommandMapping> register(CommandCallable callable,
                                                                java.util.List<java.lang.String> aliases,
                                                                com.google.common.base.Function<java.util.List<java.lang.String>,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> callback)
        Register a given command using a given list of aliases.

        The provided callback function will be called with a list of aliases that are not taken (from the list of aliases that were requested) and it should return a list of aliases to actually register. Aliases may be removed, and if no aliases remain, then the command will not be registered. It may be possible that no aliases are available, and thus the callback would receive an empty list. New aliases should not be added to the list in the callback as this may cause IllegalArgumentException to be thrown.

        The first non-conflicted alias becomes the "primary alias."

        Parameters:
        callable - The command
        aliases - A list of aliases
        callback - The callback
        Returns:
        The registered command mapping, unless no aliases could be registered
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if new conflicting aliases are added in the callback

      • remove

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<CommandMapping> remove(java.lang.String alias)
        Remove a mapping identified by the given alias.
        Parameters:
        alias - The alias
        Returns:
        The previous mapping associated with the alias, if one was found

      • getCommands

        public java.util.Set<CommandMapping> getCommands()
        Description copied from interface: Dispatcher
        Get a list of commands. Each command, regardless of how many aliases it may have, will only appear once in the returned set.

        The returned collection cannot be modified.

        Specified by:
        getCommands in interface Dispatcher
        Returns:
        A list of registrations

      • call

                    java.lang.String arguments,
                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> parents)
             throws CommandException
        Description copied from interface: CommandCallable
        Execute the command based on input arguments.

        The implementing class must perform the necessary permission checks.

        Specified by:
        call in interface CommandCallable
        Parameters:
        source - The caller of the command
        arguments - The raw arguments for this command
        parents - A stack of parent commands, where the first entry is the root command
        Returns:
        Whether a command was processed
        Throws:
        CommandException - Thrown on a command error

      • testPermission

        public boolean testPermission(CommandSource source)
        Description copied from interface: CommandCallable
        Test whether this command can probably be executed by the given source.

        If implementations are unsure if the command can be executed by the source, true should be returned. Return values of this method may be used to determine whether this command is listed in command listings.

        Specified by:
        testPermission in interface CommandCallable
        Parameters:
        source - The caller of the command
        Returns:
        Whether permission is (probably) granted
